thread.title: CPAC Attendees Unknowingly Wave Russian Flags During Trump Speech
thread.title_full: CPAC Attendees Unknowingly Wave Russian Flags During Trump Speech

author: Jeff Neukom
title: CPAC Attendees Unknowingly Wave Russian Flags During Trump Speech
text:
CPAC Attendees Unknowingly Wave Russian Flags During Trump Speech "... you will be removed." Share on Facebook 853 Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
On Friday, Republican supporters at the Conservative Political Action Conference fell victim to a bit of trickery on behalf of a liberal activist in the crowd. 
The individual, Ryan Clayton , passed out tiny Russian flags with “TRUMP” embossed in gold letters. Snapchat's CPAC story caught video of the guy handing out the Russian Trump flags pic.twitter.com/P3lXV5IdIE 
— Peter Hamby (@PeterHamby) February 24, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below Trump Promises Military Buildup To Send A Global Message 
Photos posted on Twitter, show people enthusiastically holding the flags next to a stern-faced man scanning the audience and holding several of the flags in his hands. Crowd at CPAC waving these little pro-Trump flags that look exactly like the Russian flag. Staffers quickly come around to confiscate them. pic.twitter.com/YhPpkwFCNc 
— Peter Hamby (@PeterHamby) February 24, 2017 
“They saw red, white and blue — with ‘TRUMP’ stamped across it — and started to wave them. Gave no thought to Russian flag, they all said,” wrote Tim Alberta of Politico. Advertisement - story continues below 
CPAC staffers scrambled to confiscate the flags, which attendees flew unknowingly during President Donald Trump’s speech Friday morning. Clayton was escorted from the event. 
“If you’re waving them, you will be removed,” one guard told attendees. 
One attendee from San Francisco said he wanted to keep the Trump flag as a souvenir, but lamented a perceived lack of humor on behalf of CPAC staffers. 
The incident was not Clayton’s first outspoken act toward the president. In December, he claimed Moscow had hijacked the November election to help Trump. Advertisement - story continues below Hannity: Liberal Media Thinks Name-Calling Is A One-Way Street “Russians hacking our democracy to elect Trump should tell you everything you need to know about him,” he told KTVZ in Oregon at the time. “If Putin picked our president, not we the people, then Trump must be rejected by the electoral college.” Clayton also leads the group behind a series of YouTube videos that besought presidential electors to ditch Trump, despite the election results. The group is called Americans Take Action. 
Antics aside, CPAC amounted to a something of a victory lap for the Trump administration. Reince Priebus, Trump’s chief of staff, and Stephen K. Bannon, the White House chief strategist, made a joint appearance. 
White House counselor Kellyanne Conway was another component of the program, with her talk coming on the heels of criticisms she’d made of feminism, wherein she sought to redefine the movement . 
Trump highlighted his efforts to “massively lower taxes” and replace the Affordable Care Act, drawing cheers by calling it “the disaster known as Obamacare.” 
The president also used CPAC as a show of force, touting his administration’s perceived successes thus far, including pulling out of a major trade deal, reducing regulations, cracking down on illegal immigrants and clearing the way for construction of major oil pipelines. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
